stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on Quest 11’s oil-rig stage, prototyping a cement-pit ‘footprint’ mechanic, tweaking the new HUD health bar, and brainstorming worker-themed NPCs. He also reviewed color issues in a temple map and confirmed the removal of player skins in favor of a coin-based upgrade shop.

development_findings.summary: The old player-select ‘skins’ feature has been cut; coins will instead purchase house décor or power-ups (e.g., a 100-coin Power Star that grants double-jump + invincibility).
development_findings.quote: I decided we're not gonna have skins. Instead maybe we'll make it so the player can buy … a power star that will give you a double jump and invincibility for like a hundred coins.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a new HUD health bar that starts centered, slides to top-left, then re-centers on damage; speed and placement still being tuned with Biobak’s feedback.
development_findings.quote: Whenever you take damage it comes back into the middle … movement is a bit slow, you could make it at least two times as fast.

development_findings.summary: Quest 11 red-coin star is complete; falling into the sea will now cost only 1 HP instead of forcing a reset, based on play-testing with Zeina.
development_findings.quote: I watched Zeina play it and she would have had to restart the game 15 times, so … if it's painful to watch them I need to make it easier.

development_findings.summary: Designed worker-themed NPC set: helmeted Koopas/Goombas, bulkier Koopas, thwomps with back shields & warning signs, a crane-mounted thwomp, glass-carrying Koopas, and an overseer Wiggler that gets progressively angrier.
development_findings.quote: Wiggler with a construction helmet on every one of his pieces … every time something bad happens he's gonna get more and more upset.

development_findings.summary: Cement-pit footprint system now renders directly to a 127×64 texture rather than spawning geometry, eliminating triangle/memory limits and enabling unlimited, persistent prints.
development_findings.quote: This way we don't have a limit on the footprint either.

development_findings.summary: Switched from rotated 4×3 footprint sprites to circular prints to avoid complex image-rotation math; still plans ground-pound & dive variants and step-frequency tuning.
Addressed memory corruption by clamping footprint write coordinates; still needs N64 hardware testing.
Temple map’s gray bricks judged ‘color vomit’; plan is to shift toward desaturated gold/brown before geometry rework, with Biobak providing textures.
development_findings.quote: Holy shit this is so ugly … maybe like a more golden would that take long to do? That already starts to look better.

development_findings.summary: Considering 3–4 purchasable mini-games to raise total to 175 stars, though past hacks’ mini-games were ‘ass’.
Discussed releasing a second demo featuring the first three levels with all recent improvements.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design rule: if watching a tester struggle is ‘painful’, difficulty is reduced.
context_findings.quote: My bar is usually when I watch the player and it's painful to watch them, I need to make it easier.

context_findings.summary: He strongly opposes relying on the Mario 64 PC port and would use Unreal if he wanted PC-only visuals.
context_findings.quote: If I wanted my game to be PC only and have nicer graphics, I would just use Unreal Engine and not a shitty, garbage emulated PC version of Mario.

context_findings.summary: Believes Twitch is ‘dying’ and is shifting focus to YouTube streams.
context_findings.quote: Twitch has made the decision to just squeeze out the last bit of money … before it inevitably burns down.

context_findings.summary: Personal notes: first visit to Dairy Queen, dislikes coffee, comedic banter with chat and Zeina.
Expressed disdain for Yoshi’s Island DS and certain classic Mario titles, revealing selective nostalgia.
context_findings.quote: It is the worst and actual insult to Yoshi.

biobak.summary: Gave real-time feedback on HUD placement/speed and level color palette; will re-texture the temple once colors are finalized.
biobak.quote: Movement is a bit slow—you could make it at least two times as fast.

zeina.summary: Her struggle with oil-rig water reset led to new 1-HP penalty rule.
zeina.quote: She would have had to restart the game 15 times.

zeina.summary: Created 8×12 ground-pound and dive footprint textures; currently animating a ‘pouty’ Bowser.

key_stories.title: Cement Pit Footprints
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted a reactive cement area where Mario leaves prints but faced triangle/memory limits. After debating per-print decals versus fade-outs, he opted to render directly to a texture, clamped coordinates, and simplified to circular sprites.
key_stories.challenge: Storing potentially hundreds of decals without tanking N64 performance.
key_stories.process: Explored 32-entry decal arrays → decided on 127×64 render-to-texture → fixed memory boundaries → tuned step frequency.
key_stories.outcome: Working, unlimited footprints that visibly darken the cement; rotation and special prints still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: This way we don't have a limit on the footprint either.

key_stories.title: Skins Replaced by Upgrade Shop
key_stories.summary: Original plan for collectible character skins was dropped. Coins will fund house cosmetics and functional power-ups, reshaping progression and difficulty balance.
key_stories.challenge: Skins offered little gameplay value and complicated production.
key_stories.process: On-stream decision; brainstormed coin prices and advantages.
key_stories.outcome: Power Star upgrade (double jump + invincibility) proposed; shop concept now central to coin economy.
key_stories.key_quote: Skins are gone; maybe the player can buy a power star for like a hundred coins.

key_stories.title: Temple Color Overhaul
key_stories.summary: A temple stage was deemed ‘color vomit’. Kaze and Biobak discussed shifting gray bricks toward Mario-style gold/brown before Biobak remodels.
key_stories.process: Live palette swaps, sky/water matching tests, El Dorado references.
key_stories.outcome: Agreed on desaturated yellow-brown palette; texture pass scheduled.
key_stories.key_quote: I think that's already a good start—it's definitely more appropriate Mario color-wise.

key_stories.title: Worker-Themed NPC Line-Up
key_stories.summary: To sell the oil-rig theme, the team listed six new NPC types with interactive gags and hazards.
key_stories.challenge: Making construction setting feel alive and original.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed models, gear, and behaviors (e.g., glass-carrying Koopas, warning-sign thwomps, overseer Wiggler).
key_stories.outcome: Solidified asset list; next step is modeling and programming.
key_stories.key_quote: We need thwomps with back shields so you can't just destroy them.

open_questions.context: Rotation math was avoided by switching to circular prints; ground-pound and dive variants still undecided.
questions: Will prints eventually fade, persist, or trigger gameplay consequences?

open_questions.context: Skins were cut in favor of purchasable items and power-ups, but only rough ideas were shared.

open_questions.context: Kaze floated adding ‘maybe four’ mini-games despite past hacks’ poor examples.
